message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.CL 

The paper deals with the problem of oversegmenting 3D point clouds, which is a task commonly encountered in computer vision and machine learning. The proposed approach involves learning deep embeddings of the local geometry and radiometry of 3D points, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision and machine learning for tasks such as image classification and object detection. The paper also formulates point cloud oversegmentation as a graph partition problem, which is a technique commonly used in graph theory and optimization. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.GR (Computer Graphics), and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
